case_body_condition: Not recognizable - Partial skeletal parts only
case_circumstances: Extremely degraded skeletal remains were discovered off of a forest road in the Tualatin Mountains on May 10, 1986.  The remains appear to have been exposed for a long period of time, and coins found with the remains were dated 1919, 1896, and 1881.  This appears to have been a suicide, as a rusted revolver was also located near the remains with one spent cartridge case under the hammer.
fingerprints: Fingerprint information is currently not available
case_footwear: Remnants of leather "high top" style shoes
case_jewelry: Yellow metal plated Sears & Robuck pocket watch
case_other_items_with_body:
Four brass tokens bearing the letters "D" and P"
A "V" nickel dated 1888
A penny dated 1919
A penknife with the insignia "FOE" (Fraternal Order of Eagles)
A silver WAHL EVERSHARP mechanical pencil
dental: Dental information / charting is currently not available
documents: There are currently no documents available for this case.
